EmailTemplate.subject: RE: Introduction to MBO Partners (1384299748.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly: - - - - 90 Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE MicrosoftInternetExplorer4 Hi Jay, Let me escalate on my end with our controller and see what I hear back. What’s happening is in PA sales tax is not required on “consulting services” that have a “statement of work” but it IS required on work that that is categorized as “ temporary staff” (which independent contractors can fall into). Your accountant has made a determination that people like Ervin fall into this “Statement of Work” category. I need to see if we are comfortable with that and if so, what we would need in order to document it. Basically we are taking a more conservative approach and assuming IC’s fall into the taxable category unless proven otherwise. I need to see if we comfortable with classifying Ervin the way your accountant has advised you. Let me work on this and get back to you, if there is a way to do it I will find it. Thanks, Sara ___________________________________ SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://www.mbopartners.com/> We’ve got some serious perks you’re eligible to win when you refer a friend <http://referral.mbopartners.com/referral-program?r=conde> to MBO Partners! Ask me about them. Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. From: Jay Miller [mailto:jmiller@proactivestaff.com] Sent: Tuesday, November 12, 2013 6:28 PM To: Sara Conde Cc: 'Mary Beth Goul'; 'Ervin McFadden' Subject: RE: Introduction to MBO Partners Well, Mary Beth and I are as close to a controller as we have. We do not charge sales tax on any of our services (except for Perm Placement). This is in line with the advice we have gotten from our accountant. I have worked at multiple companies, providing these exact services and sales tax has never been charged for IT consulting. I know that none of our competitors are charging sales tax for these services. I also know that our customer won’t accept having to pay sales tax for these services as they don’t pay sales tax to any of their other IT consulting vendors. So I’m not sure what the next step is at this point, but I can’t have MBO charging us sales tax when we are unable to charge sales tax to our customer. I’m available tomorrow to discuss. ThanksJay Jay Miller | ProActiveStrategies | Credible. Qualified. Trustworthy.O: 610.933.5700 | M: 610.733.3094 | proactivestaff.com <proactivestaff.com> | LinkedIn <linkd.in/R8w0LF> | Facebook <on.fb.me/R8w91F> | Twitter <twitter.com/ProActiveStaff> From: Sara Conde [mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>] Sent: Tuesday, November 12, 2013 6:15 PM To: Jay Miller Cc: 'Mary Beth Goul'; 'Ervin McFadden' Subject: RE: Introduction to MBO Partners Hi Jay, Per PA state law sales tax would be applicable on Ervin’s services for both of these projects. Now, because you are reselling these services to your end client it likely you have (or could request) a resellers certificate from them. Basically it is a form that absolves you from the responsibility of sales tax since your organization is not the final destination. Could you talk to your controller about this? Or if you prefer I am happy to speak with them. Thanks Jay, Sara ___________________________________ SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://www.mbopartners.com/> We’ve got some serious perks you’re eligible to win when you refer a friend <http://referral.mbopartners.com/referral-program?r=conde> to MBO Partners! Trustworthy.O: 610.933.5700 | M: 610.733.3094 | proactivestaff.com <proactivestaff.com> | LinkedIn <linkd.in/R8w0LF> | Facebook <on.fb.me/R8w91F> | Twitter <twitter.com/ProActiveStaff> From: Sara Conde [mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>] Sent: Monday, November 11, 2013 5:20 PM To: Jay Miller Cc: Mary Beth Goul; Ervin McFadden Subject: RE: Introduction to MBO Partners Hi Jay, Certainly. Sales tax on services different for each state. Some states have sales tax on services others do not and each has their own set of rules and criteria. Ultimately it is “destination tax” so it depends on the following: · Location where the work is being performed (full address)· Location (full address) of the final destination or “delivery” of that work (i.e. direct to your location or on to your end client) If you let me know these items I will get back to you to ensure no sales tax is applicable for this work.
